main event: Radar operators observed one to two large, bright objects traveling at high speed near Balmorhea, Texas, on November 6, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were recorded moving at approximately 1,000 mph on radar,The observations lasted between 30 to 45 minutes,The radar blips were unusually bright and steady, differing from typical aircraft returns,The objects descended from 30,000 feet to 20,000 feet before accelerating out of range,The sighting was confirmed by three experienced radar operators.
sighted object: one to two large bright objects on radar
